intro: Cleidion obovatum, commonly known as the broad-ovate cleidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features large, broad, ovate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, producing a pale yellow to greenish hue. Cleidion obovatum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
